results.title: Concepts, memories & catagories
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Examines the cognitive changes occuring in children between 5 & 7 years. Reviews research on conceptual and memory development, logical reasoning and problem solving. Observes a Japanese child assuming family responsibilities, Russian children joining the Young Pioneers and Brazilian children participating in church rituals.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS

results.title: Concepts in science: physics
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description: This series is designed to be used as a teaching tool to explain concepts in physics. Each tape consists six episodes and each concept is accompanied by excellent computer graphics and explanatory diagrams.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario

results.title: Concepts in science: biology
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description: This series looks at a range of topics associated with the study of biology. Clear animated diagrams, and concise format, (each episode on each topic runs for ten minutes), makes this an ideal teaching tool.
